hook.text: A French doctor was too embarrassed to press his ear against a young woman's chest. So he improvised.

buildup.text: RenÃ© Laennec rolled up a sheet of paper into a tube and listened through it in 1816.

discovery.text: The tube amplified heart sounds far better than direct contact. He could hear things never noticed.

twist.text: He refined it into a wooden cylinderâ€”the first stethoscope. Doctors could finally hear inside the body.

climax.text: For the first time, doctors could diagnose heart and lung diseases without cutting patients open.

punchline.text: Embarrassment invented one of medicine's greatest tools.

quiz.question: Why did Laennec invent the stethoscope?
options: He was embarrassed to press his ear to a patient's chest
He wanted to amplify very faint heartbeats
He needed to diagnose lung diseases remotely
